items.sentence: By the time I got to school, the class had already finished.
Have you finished reading the book I lent you the other day?
I thought you said you were going to be in Boston this week.
It was only yesterday that I realized what she really meant.
Are you interested in participating in this discussion, Tom?
Because of the heavy fog, not a single person could be seen.
We have more important things that need to be taken care of.
We now have all the evidence we need to convict Tom Jackson.
Tom doesn\'t need to be told more than once to do something.
Tom doesn\'t only teach the guitar, he often gives concerts.
Tom doesn\'t remember too much about what happened that day.
Tom doesn\'t like it when people park in front of his house.
Don\'t let Tom eat dessert until he\'s eaten his vegetables.
Tom can\'t figure out how to fill out this application form.
Tom couldn\'t control himself when he saw Mary kissing John.
Tom is the only one who thinks it\'s a good idea to do that.
You should concentrate on one thing and learn to do it well.
You should go to the dentist and have that tooth pulled out.
Tom can\'t carry all those suitcases so you should help him.
Tom can\'t get out of his sleeping bag. The zipper is stuck.
